Privacy
Open Source Open Source Software refers to computer programs that make their code freely available to the public. This allows for the code to be analyzed for any security flaws and malicious code. The code can also be "forked" and turned into a new application if anyone wishes to do so.
Default Global Privacy Control Global Privacy Control is a specification that can be toggled as a setting in some browsers that tells websites if the user wants their information to be sold or shared. This setting is legally binding in certain areas such as California, Europe, and potentially Bermuda

Delete Data When Site Closes
Redirect AMP Sites AMP, or Accelerated Mobile Pages is an HTML framework created by Google that is built for mobile browsers and intended to help webpages load faster. Many AMP sites are hosted on Google but designed to look like they're not, giving Google more control over the web and a better ability to track you.
Prevent Bounce Tracking Bounce Tracking is a form of tracking where a tracking website is inserted between the site you're on and the link you're trying to visit. Browsers that prevent bounce tracking will skip this tracking site and take you directly to the destination site..
With Enhanced Tracking Protection Enabled

Containers Containers, also known as Multi-Account Containers is a feature that allows the user to groups tabs into different containers, each categorized by a certain color and symbol. Each containers holds its own set of cookies and data, and does not allow that information to leak outside of the container.
Currently in development
